message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper deals with unsupervised learning of morphology in Semitic languages using distributed word representations. This involves natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning techniques, which are covered in the Computer Science sub-categories of cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper also discusses the construction of an unsupervised root extractor, which involves rule-based systems and artificial intelligence techniques, making cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) a likely sub-category as well. Additionally, the paper deals with the syntactico-semantic information in distributed word representations, which involves neural networks and deep learning, making cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) a possible sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the morphology of Semitic languages, which involves linguistics and computational linguistics, making cs.SD (Sound and Music Computing; Speech and Dialogue) a possible sub-category as well.
